TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit XamlReaderSettings extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Specifies processing rules or option settings for a implementation.

remarks.format:
## Remarks By default, an initialized <xref:System.Xaml.XamlReaderSettings> object uses values for its properties that correspond to expected defaults, such as `false` for Boolean properties or null values for reference-type properties. Default initialization results in the following values:
- The <xref:System.Xaml.XamlReaderSettings.BaseUri%2A> and <xref:System.Xaml.XamlReaderSettings.LocalAssembly%2A> properties are `null`.
- The <xref:System.Xaml.XamlReaderSettings.IgnoreUidsOnPropertyElements%2A> property is `false`.
- The <xref:System.Xaml.XamlReaderSettings.ProvideLineInfo%2A> property is `false` in the object model; however, it can be set to `true` at run time based on the loaded executables and their debug settings, or by XAML schema context.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

remarks.format: ## Remarks For more information about initialization of a <xref:System.Xaml.XamlReaderSettings> default instance, see <xref:System.Xaml.XamlReaderSettings>.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(class System.Xaml.XamlReaderSettings settings) cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class based on values in another object.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This constructor supports the merging of settings for XAML readers where additional settings can also come from other participants in the reader process.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the root object may include members that have a protected code access model when it reports the XAML type representation.
Docs.value: if the root object may include members that have a protected code access model; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks This setting is relevant to some XAML implementations such as WPF where the root object is often a "factory" for generating an instance from a pattern type, when that pattern type is not always a practical object instance. For example, a root of `UserControl` has a certain meaning for WPF and Silverlight application models, and `UserControl` might have protected properties (`UserControl.Content`) that the parser needs access to. Tools and design surfaces also need access to such properties. These cases should generally be reported to the XAML type system as writable properties even though they have protected access in the backing type system.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the base URI that is used to resolve relative paths.
Docs.value: The base URI to use. The default is .

remarks.format: ## Remarks Some URI-related properties in the .NET Framework XAML Services API treat URIs for XAML namespaces as strings; however, this property uses the true <xref:System.Uri> type.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies whether the XAML reader should ignore values for attributes that exist on property elements.
Docs.value: if the reader should ignore values for attributes on property elements. if the reader should process attributes on property elements. The default is .

remarks.format: ## Remarks During localization, the `x:Uid` attribute is used to identify elements in markup so that localization tools can process XAML elements as discrete entities for localization. Attributes do not usually appear on property elements in XAML. However, `x:Uid` is an exception because some usages put localized text in a property element as content, instead of as a separate object that can receive its own `x:Uid`. Setting an <xref:System.Xaml.XamlReaderSettings.IgnoreUidsOnPropertyElements%2A> value to `true` enables a stricter mode. The default value of `false` continues to process property element `x:Uid` attributes.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the object that represents the current local assembly for processing. This assembly information is used for calls to helper APIs such as .
Gets or sets a value that specifies whether the reader can provide line number and position.
Docs.value: if the reader can provide line number and position information; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks <xref:System.Xaml.XamlReaderSettings.ProvideLineInfo%2A> is `false` in the object model; however, it can be set to `true` at run time based on the loaded executables and their debug settings.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies whether the reader enforces that all nodes are processed as a type.
Docs.value: if the reader enforces that only is contained in nodes; otherwise, . The default is .

remarks.format: ## Remarks In addition to <xref:System.String>, a possible `Value` content under some XAML implementations is <xref:System.Windows.Markup.XData>.
